page.title: 20East Norfolk 6th Form Coll.
page.content: The East Norfolk 6th Form College opened in September 1982 with 330 full time students. The college was founded as part of the reorganisation of schools in the Gt. Yarmouth area, from a mixture of Grammar and Secondary Modern schools to all ability High Schools with a separate 6th form provision. The college is housed in the buildings of the former Alderman Leach school, and work continued on its conversion for about 12 months after it was opened. The college courses catered initially for students seeking entry to higher education and study for 'O' and 'A' level examinations, but from September 1985 a CPVE course has been offered.
